intro: Psychotria spicata, commonly known as the spicate psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, spicate inflorescences that bear small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Psychotria spicata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
